name: Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue Seattle

reviews.text: Stayed here one night on business. Grabbed the room last minute, it was only $70 for a queen. I was expecting it to be of quality inn standard. The parking area is fairly small and I an extra $32 so factor that in.
reviews.title: Better than I expected and a great location

reviews.text: The check in process was a little more cumbersome than your usual hotel these days.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, rooms, service, staff

reviews.text: The elevator is a little dated so I was pleasantly surprised once I reached my room. The room had a great view, was newly renovated, had great furnishings and was very clean!
reviews.title: Managers may need to review customer service manual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at 1000 and Pan Pacific for 5 times the rate and will definitely think about the Red Lion in the future, the location is perfect for access to downtown. I honestly think its the best value.
reviews.title: Location great - hotel brutal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with a coworker for a conference, November 6th - 9th.
reviews.title: Fabulous Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 1 night over Labor Day weekend. The room was clean and comforable, parking was pricy ($26) but close, safe, and most important, available. The location was great, walking distance to everything we wanted to see (Pike Place Market, Art Museum, shopping, etc.) The front desk was very helpful, providing recomendations and reservations for dinner.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Lack of availability of luggage transport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was both a the time we checked in and the time we checked out no one was available to help with our luggage. At check in we waited in our room until they called with someone available. At check out in the morning we wanted to get started early and all the luggage carriers in the lobby were full so we hauled our own stuff out.
reviews.title: Great base for downtown

likes.liked: — The view from Room 1503 is fantastic!

reviews.title: Make it a yearly tradition
reviews.text: Spent the Labor Day Long Weekend seeing the sites and shops of Seattle. Read the reviews and though not my first choice (booked), we're very satisfied with our 3-night stay.

Got in late Friday, great front-desk, quickly assigned our room, 1503. Amazing unit with view down Pike Ave, the water and islands beyond! Comfortablish King bed, nice sized room and fantastic bathroom goodies. Towels smelled like brown sugar!
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised by the Red Lion.

likes.liked: — terrific room and excellent beds, linens, pillows

reviews.text: Check out was okay, as they were processing our payment for incidentals I noticed they missed the water ($6 bucks?) and commented on it. The girl actually bothered to recharge our card a second time, which we felt was a bit cheap given they had missed it anyways. Concierge was good, so was Bell Clerk.
reviews.title: Happy stay at the Red Lion
Walls are Paper Thin!
reviews.text: Go to a Huskie and Seahawks game every year and make it a point to stay at this hotel. Room always great and staff nothing less then gracious. The bar down stairs has the best employees I've witnessed. Work in a customer service atmosphere myself and the times we've stayed they have had some conflict with customers. Delt with the situations very perfessional. Left comment cards with management to let know what great employees they have. Went to a mariners game and stayed in a competitive hotel close by but returned to visit the bar downstairs. Left a seahawks jacket that we had purchased there and did not realize until we got home. Called and talked to manager and they kept it there until the next yearly visit. Obviously I can't say enough. I highly recommend this hotel. With out a dought.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I too was worried when I got this downtown hotel on priceline ($60/night - probably could get it for $50/night, I was doing 4stars and just dropped it down to 3 without changing the price), but was surprised at how well we were treated (not labeled as priceliners and banished to a basement room near the water heaters). We checked in at noon and the lady there was really nice and put us on whatever floor we wanted. When we entered the room it was still messy and it looked like people were still staying there - luckily no one was in there at the time so we just slowly backed out. Anyway, when we went back down to mention that the room was still occupied the lady at the desk upgraded us to a water view room for free and was just really nice. The water view room was nice because you could watch the ferries come and go at night and you could see pikes place and the sun (when it was out) was really nice on the water (there was a lot of construction in our view too, but hey..free upgrade?). Other nice things that lady did for us: gave us change for bigger bills so we could use the bus, found out which bus to take when we wanted to get to other areas or the airport (the 194 to the airport was only like $2 and it stops 2 blocks from the hotel), printed our boarding passes and was just really nice. I'd stay here again, but just if I got it through priceline - hey I'm cheap. Do avoid hotel dining though: we decided to try it out since we were soaked and freezing one night and didn't have time to change and get out to another place - overpriced and gross (rubbery chicken, tasteless sandwiches, overpriced hot chocolate (a swiss miss packet tossed into a cup of tepid water). If you don't want to stray far just go across the street to palamino's (good italian food for less than the hotel). The food was my only regret.
reviews.title: Great Hotel (avoid the restaurant though)

reviews.text: Got an excellent deal from www.hotwire.com (can't choose what room type though). Only $96 including tax!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is walking distance to everything downtown. Had a room with 2 queen beds on the top (20th floor). Room has mini bar with small fridge & sink. Even a built in bottle opener. Old Zenith tv but we were out sightseeing anyway. Bathroom was average size. Great complimentary products from Bed, Bath & Beyond.
reviews.title: Nice Surprise!

reviews.text: Lobby is nicely decorated. Downside, no pool and parking is a bit expensive at $28/day, but you do have in/out priviledges. Elephant & Castle Pub in the hotel is great! Try the 3 appies for $16!
reviews.title: Good location!

reviews.text: Would definately stay here again! :-)
reviews.title: What a Great Find!

likes.disliked: — No gift shop or business center

reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a group & we would definitely recommend it to anyone. Great location w/in walking distance to restaurants, shopping, bars, Pikes Place and the Seattle Waterfront.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.text: The staff was always willing to assist, particularly two (2) bellmen (Scott & Marlow). It was so refreshing to have them ask if they could help, instead of searching out staff!
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I was in Seattle over Veteran's Day weekend for a bowling tournament. i have never been to Seattle before so was very much looking forward to this trip. The host hotel was the Red Lion Hotel. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and had an amazing view of the sound from my room on the 18th floor. And the location of the hotel was perfect. Right around the corner from Pike's Market and right in the shopping district.
reviews.title: November 2011 stay at Red Lion Hotel in downtown Seattle, Wash.

reviews.text: The only concern I have is that when I checked in, another credit card was given to the front desk clerk to be used to charge the room on. Upon checkout, when examining the bill after leaving the hotel, I noticed that the bill was charged to credit card used when making the reservation, not the one given upon check in. To me, that is a HUGE concern.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Good location - Red Lion Downtown
reviews.text: After booking this hotel for the amazing rate I got on priceline I was a little hesitant on what to expect. From the front desk to the room and location I could not have been any happier! I have no complaints! If you are looking for somehere nice, comfortable, friendly, and in a super location, this is the place. I would definitely stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived for a four night stay during the fourth of July holiday week in 2007. We were quite pleased with the attractiveness and cleanliness of the hotel. The front desk and bell staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs. We were a little disappointed with the concierge staff, never received a smile or greeting when he was seated alone at his desk as we passed by.
reviews.title: Convenient and Attractive Downtown Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very nice and had a very comfortable king bed with 6 comfy pillows. The bathroom had great soap/shampoo amenities and look forward to buying them for my home.
reviews.title: Great View and Great Shopping Location

reviews.text: The restaurant was the most disappointing experience. During happy hour we ordered a couple drinks, and was served a cosmopolitan in a chipped, leaking glass. The server didn't notice it and quickly left as he set the drinks down. We had to go search for him to let him know about the broken glass. The service was very slow and there was no reason for it either. Nobody was dining in the restaurant and there were 3 waiters who were handling about 8 tables. On our second adventure to the restaurant/bar, we were acnowledged when entering but were completely ignored when we were seated. After 5 minutes, we got up and left and went outside the hotel for our dinner.
reviews.title: Tired, Worn and Needs Attention
Slept in a Hammock
reviews.text: Housekeeping did a good job for the most part. However, we didn't receive any service on our last night and I had to contact the front desk. They sent somebody who did a haphazard job of restocking the towels and soap amenities, but didn't clean the room in the same style that we had experienced the previous three nights.
Hotel has a convenient location in downtown Seattle and is just steps away from world class shopping and dining.
reviews.title: excellent
Great location!
reviews.text: Just got back from a 3-day stay @ the Red Lion. The location of this hotel is perfect! Right in the downtown area and blocks away from Pike Street Market. Great shopping around every corner. The room was fair, my only dissappointment with the room was the bathroom. There was a large area of mold on the ceiling above the shower/tub. A little bleach and some paint would have resolved the problem. The front desk staff was ok, but the female Concierge was unapproachable and rude. I would stay here again just because of the location.

reviews.title: Great value, consistent comfort, overall nice place
reviews.text: For the price, especially with government/military rates, this is one of the nicest places to stay in Downtown Seattle. The rooms are extremely clean, good shower, comfortable beds, and pretty spacious. Location is right off of Rainier Square, which makes shopping at places like Brooks Brothers extremely convenient.
I will give the Red Lion an excellent grade. Location is fantastic, dead-smack downtown and you can walk to all major attractions in the city. Rooms are nice, average-sized, clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Very good hotel with great location and value

reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, the staff is for the most part, surly and I really couldn't figure out why.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
Nice Hotel, Surly Service
reviews.text: Got it for US$60 a night++ at priceline so I was very satisfied with the value.
This hotel was in the centre of town.Good for Pike Market,Seattle aquarium and near to the metro link to the space needle.Good pub attached -The elephant and castle.Rooms clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Great central hotel.Rooms very good .

reviews.text: We had an excellent stay at the Red Lion in Seattle. We checked in rapidly, the room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We had a couple minor issues with the room (a/c not working and the tub drain was clogged). These were corrected immediately.
reviews.title: Would love to stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was excellent and a great bargain at only $7.50 each. It included fresh (not powdered) scrambled eggs, with or without cheese, sausages, bacon, cereals, coffee cake, bagels, and fresh made pancakes.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Red Lion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did notice that parking was expensive (as one other reviewer mentioned), but I was not parking a car at the hotel, so this was not an issue.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations - great hotel

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for three nights through expedia and got a great rate with a packaged vacation.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.text: During our conference I was very pleased to find Revolution Tea offered with the coffee service. As a tea drinker I often bring my own tea due to the lack of tea offerings. Thank You. Also the service staff providing our meals during the conference were very helpful with my questions and were able to get me desserts from the kitchen that were not sitting in the decorative raspberry sauce that was served as I am severly allergic to raspberries. This accomidation by them was much appreciated! And the concierge and bell staff were very helpful during my stay, and were able to answer questions about food options nearby.
reviews.title: Great Conference Hotel

reviews.text: This was the fourth year staying at this hotel. I was impressed from the moment I approached the building. There were numerous changes to the decor. The meeting rooms were bright as were the bathrooms. I guessed there was a change in management. The staff were very attentive without being prompted. I was very comfortable during my stay. The hotel is located close to many points of interest and just a few blocks from the lite rail. I have spent over $40 on shuttles and taxis coming from SeaTac Airport in the past. The lite rail is less than $5 for round trip. Great place to experience Downtown Seattle. Great job Red Lion Hotel!
reviews.title: Red Lion Hotel - 5th Ave Seattle

reviews.text: This hotel is convenient to the light rail from the airport, Pikes Place, the Convention Center, shopping, etc. It's also walking distance (20 minutes) from the Washington State Ferry. The decor looks fresh and is relaxing/inviting. The front desk staff was very attentive and friendly. The beds were very comfortable; even though they were a little soft for my liking, I slept well. Had a problem with my bathroom fan, but it was taken care of immediately.
reviews.title: Great decor, huge bath towels!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel that is located in the central area of downtown Seattle. The staff are superb, helpful and very polite. The room I had was very spacous and clean and the bed was to die for. Would I stay here again if I were coming back to Seattle, no doubt I would.
reviews.title: "Soaking in Seattle"

reviews.text: Located beneath the hotel is the Elephant & Castle pub, the food here is very good, wholesome and filling, the bar staff helpful, polite and very friendly, a great place to go. A tip about coming to Seattle, pack an umbrella in your bag.
reviews.title: Hotel stay at Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue

reviews.text: Had a 4 day conference at the hotel and my wife came along for the trip. The hotel is very conveniently located in downtown Seattle. We tolerated the room next to the elevator the first night. But the toilet with the pressure tank that leaks and periodically sounds like a machine gun, combined with being next to the ice machine was more than we could handle by night #2. Add to that a front desk clerk whose smart-aleck response to my request for an extra room card was unprofessional and not the kind of reply i expect at a hotel that hosts business travelers.
reviews.title: Don't Do It

reviews.text: I called the following morning and asked to have maintenance fix the toilet. When I returned later, the noise remained but the desk assured my wife that it was repaired. When I protested, I was offered a new room, which I gladly took but am reluctant to see what awaits us tonight. And I feel sorry for the poor fool who will spend the night in room 1417 and endure the noisy toilet tonight.
reviews.title: Great location - comfortable accomodations

reviews.text: The Westin isn't as convenient, and is more expensive, but worth it to avoid bad staff and bad facilities. DON'T DO IT!
reviews.title: The hotel is nice and the staff of...

reviews.text: Stayed at the Red Lion Hotel overnight during the winter holiday season. Throughout the day, the staff helped make the mood merry by providing warm drinks and fresh baked cookies for their guests. The hotel room was nice and spacious. But what sealed the deal was the location of the hotel - it was central to so many places - the infamous Pike Place Market, the shopping district, the Sea-Tac monorail. I wouldn't mind returning for a quick stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Wonderful place and people.

reviews.text: The hotel is nice and the staff of helpful (not to be confused with friendly). The location is perfect for any Seattle tourist, for it's in the heart of downtown and walking distance to Pike place market, Seattle Art Museum, the Monorail, and in the middle of a great shopping district. The rooms are not big, but clean, nice, and most have a view. There's no longer a free breakfast, parking is over $30/day, the business center does not provide free Internet access, and refrigirators are included in the rooms.
reviews.title: good location, kids wished for pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly ok, but we had higher expectations based on the reviews and the 'hype'. We had booked a room with a view, and were given one on the 6th floor. View? Its was mostly other buildings in front of the hotel! If you looked really close you could just see a small area of ocean...!
reviews.title: Great expectations.... mediocre reality

reviews.text: The airconditioning in our room was very hard to control. It was hard to stop it continually cooling down, whatever temp was set. And there was no way to turn off the fan (Well, if there was it was impossibly hard to find!!!)
reviews.title: Nightmare all around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our rate, but only if we had the buffet. There was no possibility of getting a credit against a la carte breakfast. The buffet was VERY bedicre for a hotel of this calibre, with a poor selection. I've had better in a Holiday Inn!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, wonderful location

reviews.text: On the plus side..... the location is excellent, very convenient for all areas of the city. The concierge was very helpful. And 5 stars ***** for the excellent happy hour.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Room!

reviews.text: Otherwise, not worth the high price!
reviews.title: Parking Nightmare
Room with a view
reviews.text: Booking this on priceline and never before staying in downtown Seattle we were a little worried. Our price for a three star was accepted and we could not have made a better score with the Red Lion. We had a view of the water and the mountains, a beautiful spacious room and great service. Very clean, comfy bed, free wi fi, nice lobby area. The only down side was the $26.00 per night parking fee. No need for a car and next time we won't bother to rent one especially if we are staying in the downtown area. This hotel is very centrally located. As we were checking out the couple next to us commented that they had stayed at the Hilton the night before and paid considerable more than they paid at the Red Lion and felt the Red Lion was as good if not better.

reviews.title: Fine hotel ... not "great" by any stretch of the imagination.
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Red Lion in downtown Seattle for three nights. I read the TripAdvisor reviews prior to checking in and knew from what I read that the "paper thin walls" would probably be an issue. Believe me, the notes about the walls are not exaggerated. They are incredibly thin. I couldn't believe how well I could hear everything (*every* thing) my neighbors did. It made for restless nights.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Even Better Location!
reviews.text: Beyond the walls made of balsa wood, the hotel has a bit of a dated feel. Colors are the typical golds, ruby, and forest greens. The polyester bed spread seemed cheesy, the bath towels seemed too thin, and the bathroom fixtures themselves were quite poor. My bathtub filled with water when I showered and drained very slowly. The toilet took 3-4 flushes to get everything taken care of ... oddly enough, since it made quite a stir with its mighty sucking action ... which seemed to do little.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: The iron in the room is cheap, cheap, cheap and left brown smudges on my company shirts I needed to wear to the tradeshow I was attending. The ironing board was quite stained and burnt.

We stayed overnight, the location is great and the hotel itself was in good condition. We got a great deal online but then upgraded for a small fee to get a great room with water views. We got two rooms and both were nice, modern, clean and comfy. Very roomy with king sized bed, desk/chair, reading chair w/footstool but the reading light was not bright enough. The bathroom was nice with good lighting but the water from the shower head only sprayed out from the outter perimeter and not the center so rinsing the shampoo out of my hair was a bit of a challenge. The bathroom door has a large frosted glass panel so you can see the person inside sitting on the toilet or wiping themselves off out of the shower. That is strange and posed a bit uncomfortable for my 13 year old son and his grandmother who where roommates.
reviews.title: Nice, great location but...

reviews.text: The business center is across a breezeway, then downstairs which could be uncomfortable for a woman alone. There were four of five computers which are free for printing airline tickets. For the internet, the first few minutes were free then your CC is charged. Don't recall how much since we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Fabulous City - Great Hotel!!!!

reviews.text: The front desk staff were nice but the concierge, yikes! The first day I noticed the concierge just sitting at the desk staring out the door looking totally bored. In fact he looked as if he was about to fall asleep. When I asked him about a particular store, he simply said it had closed years ago, no smile. No suggestions of other places I might be intrested in, no giving of a map or anything. The next day there was a different guy but he looked equally bored. They really need to have these guys actually doing something so they at least looked busy or better yet, they need better people for the job.
reviews.title: Nice staff-although a little disorganized

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a restaurant downstairs which serves a buffet breakfast, STAY AWAY! Ugh, for $12.95 it was awful. The pancakes were freshly made via a machine which was okay but don't expect fluffy pancakes as those were flat. The scrambled eggs were not good so I didn't finish them. The fruits were floating in water so I didn't bother with them but my mother said they were tasteless. The other selections were bacon, sausage, muffins, cereal, for the money this so called buffet was not worth it. The juices were too sweet even my teenager commented on it. I regret not ordering from the menu.
reviews.title: Great location...average room

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is nice, great location and the price was fair. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place but don't know if I would stay here again only because I prefer boutique type hotels like the Mayflower Park.
reviews.title: One night before Alaskan Cruise - will definitley be going back!

reviews.text: When I visit Seattle, I usually rent a car and stay at one of several hotels out near Seattle/Tacoma International Airport, as I find these to be a convenient base for visits to Tacoma or even Portland, as well as many other attractions in the area. However, on my most recent visit to one of my favorite cities, I decided to take advantage of a significant discount offer to stay at this comfortable new hotel very near the heart of the city. I was also able to take advantage of riding Seattle's marvelous Light Rail line from the airport to the University Plaza stop in the downtown Transit tunnel, only about a ten-minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in the heart of downtown Seattle

reviews.text: The Red Lion features large, comfortable rooms, with pillow-top mattresses and pleasant restrooms. Many rooms in the twenty-story hotel have a marvelous view of the Seattle harbor area. The hotel has two restaurants; however, one was closed for remodeling during my visit. I did take advantage of the cocktail hour pricing at the Elephant and Castle British Pub, located on the lower lobby level. (They actually have TWO Cocktail hours - one from 3 to 6 PM; the other from 10 PM to Midnight!) There are quite a few inexpensive bar snacks to be had during these times.
reviews.title: Treated with honor

reviews.text: I loved the location...right at Fifth Avenue and Pike St., less than a ten-minute walk to all of the wonders of the Pike Street Market shops!
reviews.title: Ideally situated

reviews.text: On a slightly negative note, I did find that the large windows did allow a bit of the chill December air that blows from Puget Sound to make the room a bit drafty, but I was able to set the room thermostat fairly high to overcome that discomfort. I found the Front Desk personnel to be very friendly and helpful on the several occasions I had questions.
reviews.title: Perfect for our shopping trip !

reviews.text: Because of the discount offer, I was able to enjoy two nights at this pleasant property for about the same price that I would have paid out by the airport, and I did not have the expense of a car.
reviews.title: Not as great as before

description: The Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue in downtown Seattle Washington is a distinctly different and unique hotel located within the downtown neighborhood featuring the best shopping, theaters and cultural attractions on the West Coast. Whether you're in town on business or pleasure, our impeccable service and casual northwest flair will make your stay comfortable in Seattle.The hotel is noted for its exemplary level of service and sophisticated atmosphere, with amenities to satisfy both business and leisure travelers. Our 319 smoke-free guest rooms offer stunning views of Elliott Bay and the city and feature, new Red Lion's signature plush Sealy pillowtop beds, Essential Elements bath products, terry bathrobes, Keurig coffee machines and refrigerators. On-site services include an award-winning concierge and bell staff, complimentary wi-fi, a business center and a fitness center. We also feature two restaurants; Frolik Kitchen + Cocktails on the fifth floor, including downtown Seattle's largest outdoor dining deck and seasonal summer entertainment on the patio, and Elephant & Castle British Restaurant & Pub. The Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue is walking distance to Seattle's cultural, business and shopping attractions, including the ornate 5th Avenue Theatre and the classic Paramount Theatre, the famous Pike Place Market (with the world's first Starbucks coffee house), the Washington Convention & Trade Center and over 10 million square feet of retail shopping including Macy's Northwest and Nordstrom flagship stores. The Monorail to the Seattle Center's Space Needle and the Experience Music Project (EMP) is just step away. The Benaroya Hall and Seattle Art Museum are a few blocks away from the hotel. The hotel is also positioned for convenient Fifth Avenue access to Qwest Field, home of Seattle Seahawks football, Safeco Field, home of Seattle Mariners baseball, and Seattle Storm basketball. We are one mile from Seattle University, 6 miles from the University of Washington and its Medical Center and 6 miles from the campus of Seattle Pacific University.
